alert.note: Alert for Tazewell (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 28 at 4:09AM EDT until July 28 at 6:30AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Heavy Rainfall Continues in the Advisory Area Early This Morning... ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall will continue through the early morning hours. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Virginia and southeast West Virginia, including the following counties, in southwest Virginia, Tazewell. In southeast West Virginia, Mercer. * WHEN...Until 645 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some roadways and low water crossings mayt become flooded and impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 407 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to showers and thunderstorms continuing within the advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen during the past 24 hours and an additional 1 to 2 inches of rain is likely between now and daybreak this morning. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Big Spring Branch, Bluestone River, Adair Run, Big Creek, Big Branch, Beaver Branch, Blue Spring Creek, Blacklick Creek and Beech Fork. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bluefield... Princeton... Richlands... Tazewell... Cedar Bluff... Athens... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
